meanings.definition: Of or relating to the scutellum.
meanings.sent1: The scutellar markings on the insect were fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the scutellar structure of the beetle.
meanings.sent3: The scutellar pattern on the bug looked like a tiny shield.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a scutellar design that shimmered in the light.
meanings.sent5: The scutellar coloration on the butterfly was vibrant and beautiful.

meanings.definition: Resembling a small shield or plate.
meanings.sent1: The scutellar shape of the brooch caught her eye.
meanings.sent2: The toy had a scutellar appearance that made it unique.
meanings.sent3: The scutellar pattern on the cake made it look like a shield.
meanings.sent4: His smile was warm and scutellar, offering comfort to all.
meanings.sent5: The scutellar design on the shield was intricate and detailed.

meanings.sent1: The knight carried a scutellar into battle for protection.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an ancient scutellar from the Roman era.
meanings.sent3: The chef used a scutellar to serve the appetizers at the banquet.
meanings.sent4: The scutellar on the armor gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The scutellar was engraved with intricate patterns and symbols.
